name: honeycomb
description: A Pulumi package for creating and managing honeycomb.io resources.
attribution: This Pulumi package is based on the [`honeycombio` Terraform Provider](https://github.com/honeycombio/terraform-provider-honeycombio).

caption.description: A description of the query that will be displayed on the board. Supports markdown.

dataset.description: The dataset this query is associated with.

queryAnnotationId.description: The ID of the Query Annotation to associate with this query.

queryId.description: The ID of the Query to run.

queryStyle.description: How the query should be displayed within the board, either `graph` (the default), `table` or `combo`.

column.description: The column to apply the operator to, not needed with `COUNT` or `CONCURRENCY`.

op.description: The operator to apply, see the supported list of calculation operators at [Calculation Operators](https://docs.honeycomb.io/api/query-specification/#calculation-operators).

column.description: The column to apply the filter to.

op.description: The operator to apply, see the supported list of filter operators at [Filter Operators](https://docs.honeycomb.io/api/query-specification/#filter-operators). Not all operators require a value.

value.description: The value used for the filter. Not needed if op is `exists`, `not-exists`, `in` or `not-in`. Mutually exclusive with the other `value_*` options.

valueBoolean.description: Deprecated: use 'value' instead. The value used for the filter when the column is a boolean. Mutually exclusive with `value` and the other `value_*` options.
valueBoolean.deprecationMessage: Use of attribute `value_boolean` is discouraged and will fail to plan if using 'false'. Use of `value` is encouraged.

valueFloat.description: Deprecated: use 'value' instead. The value used for the filter when the column is a float. Mutually exclusive with `value` and the other `value_*` options.
valueFloat.deprecationMessage: Use of attribute `value_float` is discouraged and will fail to plan if using '0'. Use of `value` is encouraged.

valueInteger.description: Deprecated: use 'value' instead. The value used for the filter when the column is an integer. Mutually exclusive with `value` and the other `value_*` options.
valueInteger.deprecationMessage: Use of attribute `value_integer` is discouraged and will fail to plan if using '0'. Use of `value` is encouraged.

valueString.description: Deprecated: use 'value' instead. The value used for the filter when the column is a string. Mutually exclusive with `value` and the other `value_*` options.
valueString.deprecationMessage: Use of attribute `value_string` is discouraged and will fail to plan if using the empty string. Use of `value` is encouraged.

calculateOp.description: The calculation operator to apply, supports all of the [Calculation Operators](https://docs.honeycomb.io/api/query-specification/#calculation-operators) with the exception of `HEATMAP`.

column.description: The column to apply the `calculate_op` to, not needed with `COUNT` or `CONCURRENCY`.

op.description: The operator to apply to filter the query results. One of `=`, `!=`, `>`, `>=`, `<`, or `<=`.

value.description: The value used with `op`. Currently assumed to be a number.

column.description: Either a column present in `breakdown` or a column to `op` applies to.

op.description: The calculation operator to apply, see the supported list of calculation operators at [Calculation Operators](https://docs.honeycomb.io/api/query-specification/#calculation-operators).

order.description: The sort direction, if set must be `ascending` or `descending`.

id.description: The ID of an already existing recipient. Should not be used in combination with `type` and `target`.

target.description: Target of the trigger recipient, this has another meaning depending on the type of recipient (see the table below). Should not be used in combination with `id`.

type.description: The type of the trigger recipient, allowed types are `email`, `marker`, `pagerduty`, `slack` and `webhook`. Should not be used in combination with `id`.

op.description: The operator to apply, allowed threshold operators are `>`, `>=`, `<`, and `<=`.

value.description: The value to be used with the operator.

provider.description:
The provider type for the honeycombio package. By default, resources use package-wide configuration
settings, however an explicit `Provider` instance may be created and passed during resource
construction to achieve fine-grained programmatic control over provider settings. See the
[documentation](https://www.pulumi.com/docs/reference/programming-model/#providers) for more information.

description.description: Description of the board. Supports markdown.

queries.description: Zero or more configurations blocks (described below) with the queries of the board.

style.description: How the board should be displayed in the UI, either `list` (the default) or `visual`.

description.description: Description of the board. Supports markdown.

queries.description: Zero or more configurations blocks (described below) with the queries of the board.

style.description: How the board should be displayed in the UI, either `list` (the default) or `visual`.

stateInputs.description: Input properties used for looking up and filtering Board resources.

queries.description: Zero or more configurations blocks (described below) with the queries of the board.

style.description: How the board should be displayed in the UI, either `list` (the default) or `visual`.

dataset.description: The dataset this column is added to.

description.description: A description that is shown in the UI.

hidden.description: Whether this column should be hidden in the query builder and sample data. Defaults to false.

keyName.description: The name of the column. Must be unique per dataset.

type.description: The type of the column, allowed values are `string`, `float`, `integer` and `boolean`. Defaults to `string`.

dataset.description: The dataset this column is added to.

description.description: A description that is shown in the UI.

hidden.description: Whether this column should be hidden in the query builder and sample data. Defaults to false.

type.description: The type of the column, allowed values are `string`, `float`, `integer` and `boolean`. Defaults to `string`.

type.description: The type of the column, allowed values are `string`, `float`, `integer` and `boolean`. Defaults to `string`.

stateInputs.description: Input properties used for looking up and filtering Dataset resources.

alias.description: The name of the derived column. Must be unique per dataset.

dataset.description: The dataset this derived column is added to.

description.description: A description that is shown in the UI.

expression.description: The function of the derived column. See [Derived Column Syntax](https://docs.honeycomb.io/working-with-your-data/customizing-your-query/derived-columns/#derived-column-syntax).

alias.description: The name of the derived column. Must be unique per dataset.

dataset.description: The dataset this derived column is added to.

description.description: A description that is shown in the UI.

expression.description: The function of the derived column. See [Derived Column Syntax](https://docs.honeycomb.io/working-with-your-data/customizing-your-query/derived-columns/#derived-column-syntax).

stateInputs.description: Input properties used for looking up and filtering DerivedColumn resources.

alias.description: The name of the derived column. Must be unique per dataset.

dataset.description: The dataset this derived column is added to.

description.description: A description that is shown in the UI.

expression.description: The function of the derived column. See [Derived Column Syntax](https://docs.honeycomb.io/working-with-your-data/customizing-your-query/derived-columns/#derived-column-syntax).

dataset.description: The dataset this marker is placed on.

type.description: The type of the marker, Honeycomb.io can display markers in different colors depending on their type.

url.description: A target for the Marker. If you click on the Marker text, it will take you to this URL.

dataset.description: The dataset this marker is placed on.

type.description: The type of the marker, Honeycomb.io can display markers in different colors depending on their type.

url.description: A target for the Marker. If you click on the Marker text, it will take you to this URL.

stateInputs.description: Input properties used for looking up and filtering Marker resources.

dataset.description: The dataset this marker is placed on.

type.description: The type of the marker, Honeycomb.io can display markers in different colors depending on their type.

url.description: A target for the Marker. If you click on the Marker text, it will take you to this URL.

dataset.description: The dataset this query is added to.

queryJson.description: A JSON object describing the query according to the [Query Specification](https://docs.honeycomb.io/api/query-specification/#fields-on-a-query-specification). While the JSON can be constructed manually, it is easiest to use the `honeycomb.GetQuerySpecification` data source.

dataset.description: The dataset this query is added to.

queryJson.description: A JSON object describing the query according to the [Query Specification](https://docs.honeycomb.io/api/query-specification/#fields-on-a-query-specification). While the JSON can be constructed manually, it is easiest to use the `honeycomb.GetQuerySpecification` data source.

stateInputs.description: Input properties used for looking up and filtering Query resources.

dataset.description: The dataset this query is added to.

queryJson.description: A JSON object describing the query according to the [Query Specification](https://docs.honeycomb.io/api/query-specification/#fields-on-a-query-specification). While the JSON can be constructed manually, it is easiest to use the `honeycomb.GetQuerySpecification` data source.

dataset.description: The dataset this query is added to.

description.description: The description for the query annotation.

name.description: The name of the query annotation that will display in the Honeycomb UI.

queryId.description: The ID of the query that the annotation will be created on. Note that a query can have more than one annotation.

dataset.description: The dataset this query is added to.

description.description: The description for the query annotation.

name.description: The name of the query annotation that will display in the Honeycomb UI.

queryId.description: The ID of the query that the annotation will be created on. Note that a query can have more than one annotation.

stateInputs.description: Input properties used for looking up and filtering QueryAnnotation resources.

dataset.description: The dataset this query is added to.

description.description: The description for the query annotation.

name.description: The name of the query annotation that will display in the Honeycomb UI.

queryId.description: The ID of the query that the annotation will be created on. Note that a query can have more than one annotation.

dataset.description: The dataset this trigger is associated with.

disabled.description: The state of the trigger. If true, the trigger will not be run. Defaults to false.

frequency.description: The interval (in seconds) in which to check the results of the query’s calculation against the threshold. Value must be divisible by 60 and between 60 and 86400 (between 1 minute and 1 day). Defaults to 900 (15 minutes).

queryId.description: The ID of the Query that the Trigger will execute.

recipients.description: Zero or more configuration blocks (described below) with the recipients to notify when the trigger fires.

threshold.description: A configuration block (described below) describing the threshold of the trigger.

dataset.description: The dataset this trigger is associated with.

disabled.description: The state of the trigger. If true, the trigger will not be run. Defaults to false.

frequency.description: The interval (in seconds) in which to check the results of the query’s calculation against the threshold. Value must be divisible by 60 and between 60 and 86400 (between 1 minute and 1 day). Defaults to 900 (15 minutes).

queryId.description: The ID of the Query that the Trigger will execute.

recipients.description: Zero or more configuration blocks (described below) with the recipients to notify when the trigger fires.

threshold.description: A configuration block (described below) describing the threshold of the trigger.

stateInputs.description: Input properties used for looking up and filtering Trigger resources.

dataset.description: The dataset this trigger is associated with.

disabled.description: The state of the trigger. If true, the trigger will not be run. Defaults to false.

frequency.description: The interval (in seconds) in which to check the results of the query’s calculation against the threshold. Value must be divisible by 60 and between 60 and 86400 (between 1 minute and 1 day). Defaults to 900 (15 minutes).

queryId.description: The ID of the Query that the Trigger will execute.

recipients.description: Zero or more configuration blocks (described below) with the recipients to notify when the trigger fires.

threshold.description: A configuration block (described below) describing the threshold of the trigger.

honeycomb:index/getDatasets:GetDatasets.description:
## # Data Source: honeycomb.GetDatasets

The datasets data source allows the datasets of an account to be retrieved.

inputs.description: A collection of arguments for invoking GetDatasets.

startsWith.description: Only return datasets starting with the given value.

outputs.description: A collection of values returned by GetDatasets.

id.description: The provider-assigned unique ID for this managed resource.

names.description: a list of all the dataset names.

slugs.description: a list of all the dataset slugs.

inputs.description: A collection of arguments for invoking GetQuerySpecification.

breakdowns.description: A list of fields to group by.

calculations.description: Zero or more configuration blocks (described below) with the calculations that should be displayed. If no calculations are specified, `COUNT` will be used.

endTime.description: The absolute end time of the query in Unix Time (= seconds since epoch).

filterCombination.description: How to combine multiple filters, either `AND` (default) or `OR`.

filters.description: Zero or more configuration blocks (described below) with the filters that should be applied.

granularity.description: The time resolution of the query’s graph, in seconds. Valid values must be in between the query’s time range /10 at maximum, and /1000 at minimum.

havings.description: Zero or more filters used to restrict returned groups in the query result.

limit.description: The maximum number of query results, must be between 1 and 1000.

orders.description: Zero or more configuration blocks (described below) describing how to order the query results. Each term must appear in either `calculation` or `breakdowns`.

startTime.description: The absolute start time of the query in Unix Time (= seconds since epoch).

timeRange.description: The time range of the query in seconds, defaults to two hours.

outputs.description: A collection of values returned by GetQuerySpecification.

id.description: The provider-assigned unique ID for this managed resource.

json.description: JSON representation of the query according to the [Query Specification](https://docs.honeycomb.io/api/query-specification/#fields-on-a-query-specification), can be used as input for other resources.

inputs.description: A collection of arguments for invoking GetTriggerRecipient.

dataset.description: Search through all triggers linked to this dataset.

target.description: Target of the trigger, this has another meaning depending on the type of recipient (see the table below).

type.description: The type of recipient, allowed types are `email`, `marker`, `pagerduty`, `slack` and `webhook`.

outputs.description: A collection of values returned by GetTriggerRecipient.

id.description: The provider-assigned unique ID for this managed resource.
